radiographic_examinations.findings: In the right lower quadrant, there is a 6.0 x 3.9 cm segment of the cecum which appears swollen and hyperemic. The appendix is visualized just medially and is mildly dilated up to 0.8 cm and fluid filled though intraluminal air is visualized distally. There is adjacent surrounding mesenteric fat stranding and edema. There is no free pelvic fluid or air to suggest perforation. The visualized terminal ileum does not demonstrate extensive wall thickening.
